snippet: Mazda is recalling its biggest sport utility vehicle to fix suspension parts that can rust and come loose, causing a loss of steering control.
abstract: Mazda issues recall of 206,000 CX-9 SUVs to fix or replace suspension parts that can rust and come loose, causing loss of steering control.
lead_paragraph: Mazda is recalling its biggest sport utility vehicle to fix suspension parts that can rust and come loose, causing a loss of steering control.

headline.main: Mazda Recalls CX-9 S.U.V.s for a Steering Problem
headline.print_headline: Mazda Recalls Cx-9 S.U.V.S. for a Steering Problem
